slides.title: Content
bullets: Media elements for audio and video

slides.title: CSS
bullets: All CSS styles should work fine
Many new CSS3 styles are available
Not mobile specific in any way
But extra useful in mobile web since fewer/no images needed

slides.title: CSS Prerequisites
bullets: A way to style (change the appearance of) html elements
Rules in style section of document
How CSS rules and their styles are applied
Automatically applied to elements that match the selector
element, .class, #id, >inside, space for below, comma for multiple selectors, combinations

slides.title: CSS Prerequisites, Syntax
bullets: Browser vendor specific properties has prefix
For CSS3 it is a mix of styles that work withoug prefix and that needs prefix
Samples here will use -webkit when necessary

slides.title: CSS3 Border Radius
bullets: Usually specify for all four corners
Can have different radius horizontally and vertically (oval)

slides.title: CSS3 Box and Text Shadow
bullets: Same value but different style name for box or text

slides.title: CSS3 Gradients
bullets: Smooth transition from one color to another (or even several)
Is actually an image and applicable as value for background-image property

slides.title: CSS3 Transparency
bullets: Change the opacity of the element
Opacity is the opposite of transparency, no transparency=full opacity

slides.title: CSS3 Transforms
bullets: The ability to change the coordinates for an element, without affecting the flow of the other elements
All changes specified as the -webkit-transform property

slides.title: CSS3 Box sizing
bullets: Fixes the problem of width/height not including padding, borders and margin
This is a big problem when specifying layouts/widths using percentages of the full window
Supported by Android, iOS and all modern browsers, IE since version 8
Now the width includes padding and borders, but not margin

slides.title: CSS3 Flexible Box Model
bullets: A better way to define the general layout and distribution of elements in the page
Previously, having elements expand vertically to fit each other has always needed hacks
Apply to container. Orientation can be horizontal or vertical.
Apply to inside elements that should "flex". 1 is a weighted value against the other elements.

slides.title: Images
bullets: Image loading is subject to latency
Minimize number of images for best performance
Don't deliver higher resolution images if not needed

slides.title: Inline Images
bullets: Image data inside of HTML. No need to download separate file.
Image data encoded in BASE64 format
3 binary bites will expand to 4 printable characters
Increase in size is (often) compensated for with one less server request
You need tool/server script to create the BASE64 characters
New url specification for src attribute

slides.title: Image Sprites
bullets: Use a single file for multiple images
One request for many images means better performance, always better
Merge your images into a single image file with application or web service
Need to set image as background
Can't use img element, might limit your possibilities

slides.title: Audio
bullets: Audio encoding is the tricky part
Multiple source elements for different formats
mp3 and ogg should cover most modern browsers

slides.title: Video
bullets: Video encoding is the tricky part
mp4 and webm should cover most modern browsers

slides.title: CSS3 Media Queries
bullets: A way to define different css rules depending on several properties of the browser window
